Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; trace of lotus bud in faded added white outline and added red centre; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924, 1201.858. 'φ5' is written in pencil on the interior surface. See Bailey, D. 'Some Fresh Naukratis Joins', The Annual of the British School at Athens 63, 1970, 3-4. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 168, no. 109)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 724, no. 834)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1777) (phase 2)
